verses.verse: For I do not want<WG2309> you to be unaware,<WG50> brethren,<WG80> that our fathers<WG3962> were all<WG3956> under<WG5259> the cloud,<WG3507> and all<WG3956> passed<WG1330> through<WG1330> the sea;<WG2281>
and all<WG3956> were baptized<WG907> into Moses<WG3475> in the cloud<WG3507> and in the sea;<WG2281>
and all<WG3956> ate<WG2068> the same<WG846> spiritual<WG4152> food;<WG1033>

and all<WG3956> drank<WG4095> the same<WG846> spiritual<WG4152> drink,<WG4188> for they were drinking<WG4095> from a spiritual<WG4152> rock<WG4073> which followed<WG190> them; and the rock<WG4073> was Christ.<WG5547>
Nevertheless,<WG235> with most<WG4183> of them God<WG2316> was not well-pleased; for they were laid<WG2693> low<WG2693> in the wilderness.<WG2048>
Now<WG1161> these<WG3778> things<WG3778> happened<WG1096> as examples<WG5179> for us, that we should not crave<WG1510> <WG1938> evil<WG2556> things,<WG2556> as they also<WG2548> craved.<WG1937>

And do not be idolaters,<WG1496> as some<WG5100> of them were; as it is written,<WG1125> "The people<WG2992> sat<WG2523> down<WG2523> to eat<WG2068> and drink,<WG4095> and stood<WG450> up to play.<WG3815>"
Nor<WG3366> let us act<WG4203> immorally,<WG4203> as some<WG5100> of them did,<WG4203> and twenty-three thousand<WG5505> fell<WG4098> in one<WG1520> day.<WG2250>
Nor<WG3366> let us try<WG1598> the Lord,<WG2962> as some<WG5100> of them did,<WG3985> and were destroyed<WG622> by the serpents.<WG3789>
Nor<WG3366> grumble,<WG1111> as some<WG5100> of them did,<WG1111> and were destroyed<WG622> by the destroyer.<WG3644>

Now<WG1161> these<WG3778> things<WG3778> happened<WG4819> to them as an example,<WG5179> and they were written<WG1125> for our instruction,<WG3559> upon whom<WG3739> the ends<WG5056> of the ages<WG165> have come.<WG2658>
Therefore<WG5620> let him who thinks<WG1380> he stands<WG2476> take<WG991> heed<WG991> lest<WG3361> he fall.<WG4098>

No<WG3756> temptation<WG3986> has overtaken<WG2983> you but such<WG442> as is common<WG442> to man;<WG442> and God<WG2316> is faithful,<WG4103> who<WG3739> will not allow<WG1439> you to be tempted<WG3985> beyond<WG5228> what<WG3739> you are able,<WG1410> but with the temptation<WG3986> will provide<WG4160> the way<WG1545> of escape<WG1545> also,<WG2532> that you may be able<WG1410> to endure<WG5297> it.
Therefore,<WG1355> my beloved,<WG27> flee<WG5343> from idolatry.<WG1495>
I speak<WG3004> as to wise<WG5429> men;<WG5429> you judge<WG2919> what<WG3739> I say.<WG5346>

Is not the cup<WG4221> of blessing<WG2129> which<WG3739> we bless<WG2127> a sharing<WG2842> in the blood<WG129> of Christ<WG5547>? Is not the bread<WG740> which<WG3739> we break<WG2806> a sharing<WG2842> in the body<WG4983> of Christ<WG5547>?
Since<WG3754> there is one<WG1520> bread,<WG740> we who are many<WG4183> are one<WG1520> body;<WG4983> for we all<WG3956> partake<WG3348> of the one<WG1520> bread.<WG740>
Look<WG991> at the nation<WG4561> Israel;<WG2474> are not those<WG3588> who eat<WG2068> the sacrifices<WG2378> sharers<WG2844> in the altar<WG2379>?
What<WG5101> do I mean<WG5346> then<WG3767>? That a thing<WG1494> sacrificed<WG1494> to idols<WG1494> is anything,<WG5100> or<WG2228> that an idol<WG1497> is anything<WG5100>?

[No,] but [I say] that the things which<WG3739> the Gentiles<WG1484> sacrifice,<WG2380> they sacrifice<WG2380> to demons,<WG1140> and not to God;<WG2316> and I do not want<WG2309> you to become<WG1096> sharers<WG2844> in demons.<WG1140>

You cannot<WG1410> <WG3756> drink<WG4095> the cup<WG4221> of the Lord<WG2962> and the cup<WG4221> of demons;<WG1140> you cannot<WG1410> <WG3756> partake<WG3348> of the table<WG5132> of the Lord<WG2962> and the table<WG5132> of demons.<WG1140>
Or<WG2228> do we provoke<WG3863> the Lord<WG2962> to jealousy<WG3863>? We are not stronger<WG2478> than He, are we?

All<WG3956> things<WG3956> are lawful,<WG1832> but not all<WG3956> things<WG3956> are profitable.<WG4851> All<WG3956> things<WG3956> are lawful,<WG1832> but not all<WG3956> things<WG3956> edify.<WG3618>
Let no<WG3367> one<WG3367> seek<WG2212> his own<WG1438> [good,] but that of his neighbor.<WG2087>
Eat<WG2068> anything<WG3956> that is sold<WG4453> in the meat<WG3111> market,<WG3111> without<WG3367> asking<WG350> questions<WG350> for conscience' sake;<WG1223>
for the earth<WG1093> is the Lord's, and all<WG4138> it contains.<WG4138>

If<WG1487> one<WG5100> of the unbelievers<WG571> invites<WG2564> you, and you wish<WG2309> to go,<WG4198> eat<WG2068> anything<WG3956> that is set<WG3908> before<WG3908> you, without<WG3367> asking<WG350> questions<WG350> for conscience' sake.<WG1223>

But if<WG1437> anyone<WG5100> should say<WG3004> to you, "This<WG3778> is meat sacrificed<WG7094> to idols,<WG7094>" do not eat<WG2068> [it,] for the sake<WG1223> of the one<WG1565> who informed<WG3377> [you,] and for conscience' sake;
I mean<WG3004> not your own<WG1438> conscience,<WG4893> but the other<WG2087> [man's]; for why<WG2443> <WG5101> is my freedom<WG1657> judged<WG2919> by another's conscience<WG4893>?
If<WG1487> I partake<WG3348> with thankfulness,<WG5485> why<WG5101> am I slandered<WG987> concerning<WG5228> that for which<WG3739> I give<WG2168> thanks<WG2168>?
Whether,<WG1535> then,<WG3767> you eat<WG2068> or<WG1535> drink<WG4095> or<WG1535> whatever<WG5100> you do,<WG4160> do<WG4160> all<WG3956> to the glory<WG1391> of God.<WG2316>
Give<WG1096> no<WG677> offense<WG677> either<WG2532> to Jews<WG2453> or<WG2532> to Greeks<WG1672> or<WG2532> to the church<WG1577> of God;<WG2316>

just<WG2531> as I also<WG2532> please<WG700> all<WG3956> men<WG3956> in all<WG3956> things,<WG3956> not seeking<WG2212> my own<WG1683> profit,<WG4851> but the [profit] of the many,<WG4183> that they may be saved.<WG4982>
